page.title: 06PARISH AMENITIES
page.content: Offas Dyke the great earthworks erected by King Offa in the 8th Century stretches across this block. Here is to be found one of the best stretches of the whole 168 miles length. It may have been erected as a form of defence against the Welsh, or what seems more probable in the light of modern thinking, as a line of de-markation in agreement with the Welsh. It is now a long distance path stretching from Chepstow to Prestatyn used by many walkers. This section of the Dyke has some of the most spectacular views across the bare grassy hills and fertile valleys with probably the best preserved section of the whole Dyke. The area is ideal for walking.
